document.docAuthor: Hernández-García, Luis Manuel, Burgos-Guerrero, Jesús Enrique, Rousseau, Guillaume Xavier & James, Samuel Wooster
document.masterDocTitle: Brasilisia n. gen. and Arraia n. gen., two new genera of Ocnerodrilidae (Annelida, Clitellata, Oligochaeta) from Eastern Amazonia, Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Brasilisia n. gen. and Arraia n. gen., two new genera of Ocnerodrilidae (Annelida, Clitellata, Oligochaeta) from Eastern Amazonia, Brazil

heading.emphasis: Key to the genera of Ocnerodrilidae (from Fragoso & Rojas, 2009 , extended)

paragraph.keyLead: 4. With dorsal pores and typhlosole; metandric (testes in XI), prostates in XVII, XIX, XX, XXI ( India )........................................................................................................ Deccania Gates, 1949

- Without dorsal pores and typhlosole; holandric (testes in X and XI) (Mexico)...........
Chacdrilus Fragoso & Rojas, 2009

5. Two pairs of prostates in XVII and XIX or three pairs of prostates in XVII, XIX and XX (India).......
Thatonia Gates, 1942
- One pair of prostates in XVII or two pair of prostates in XVII and XX............................................ 6

6. Holandric, prostates in XVII or XVII and XX ( India , China , Myanmar ).....................
Malabaria
Stephenson, 1924

- Metandric, prostates in XVII ( India )...............................................
Aphanascus Stephenson, 1924

8. Calciferous glands in IX and X ( India )....................................................
Curgiona Gates, 1941

9. Two pairs of prostatic glands in XVII and XIX; gizzard generally absent (Tropical Africa, Brazil ?, some peregrines)......................................................................................
Gordiodrilus Beddard, 1892

- Three pairs of prostatic glands in XVII–XIX (Africa)....................................
Nannodrilus Beddard, 1894

- Two pairs of prostates, one pair in XVII and the other in XIX (Brazil)..............................
Bauba Righi, 1980

- Prostates in XVIII ( Argentina , Ecuador , Peru )...................
Quechuona Gates, 1941
(=
Quechua Michaelsen, 1923
)

- Calciferous glands in XI ( Brazil )...................................................
Exisdrilus
Righi et al. , 1978

18. Two gizzards, one in VI and another in VII ( Ecuador )..........................................
Xibaro Righi, 1981

19. Gizzard in V, genital markings as protuberances in AB line (Brazil).............
Brasilisia Hernández-García et al.
, n. gen.
- Gizzard not in 5, no genital markings as protuberances in AB line.............................................. 20

20. Gizzard in VI ( Brazil )...................................................
Arraia Hernández-García et al.
, n. gen.

- Two pairs of spermathecae (South America, some peregrines).............................
Eukerria Michaelsen, 1935

24. Prostatic and male pores combined ( Argentine )...........................................
Gatesia Jamieson, 1962

- Prostatic and male pores separated ( Argentine , Bolivia , Brazil )...............................
Belladrilus Righi, 1984

26. Solid calciferous glands (without lumen) (Dominican Republic).............................
Temanonegia Gates, 1979

materialsCitation.keyLead:
- Calciferous glands with large, central lumen ( Central America, Africa, one peregrine)...........
Nematogenia Eisen, 1900

paragraph.keyLead:
28. One pair of prostates in XVII ( Brazil ,
Paraguay
)..........................................
Haplodrilus Eisen, 1900

- Two pairs of prostates, one pair in XVII, one pair in XIX (Brazil)..........................
Kerriona Michaelsen, 1924

- Three pairs of spermathecal pores (in VII–IX) (Equatorial Guinea)......................
Diaphorodrilus Cognetti, 1910

- Spermathecal pores in 7/8 ( Guyana , Brazil ).................................................
Liodrilus Eisen, 1900

materialsCitation.keyLead:
32. Trabeculated calciferous glands, complete or only in part (Africa, Mexico , Central and South America , some peregrines)...................................................................................
Phoenicodrilus Eisen, 1895

- Spermathecae without diverticulum ( Central and South America , one peregrine)................
Ocnerodrilus Eisen, 1878
